channel.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
channel.description:
Discuss the idea, I'm pretty sure this hasn't been suggested before.
You may see a lot of noobish tutorials being posted, such as adding shops, how to compile, ect.
Other tutorials.
How change update keys, finding update keys, protocols, discussion about anything.
Discuss.

item.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:23, topic:341070”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=437463.msg3216465#msg3216465 date=1274722834]
There is really no point in separating the tutorial board into two different ones, all you really have to do is click into the thread and have a look at the content. Or if you really want beginner and advanced tutorials to be separated, you could just add tags like [Beginner] or [Advanced] to the thread title.
[/quote]

We suck, none of us thought of that before we all posted about separating the tutorial section. :P[/quote]

No need for sucking up. But i don’t like the idea all and all, someone who is advanced might think an advanced tutorial from me is easy.

It’d be easier to desperate by division.

Read full topic
item.source: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials

item.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:18, topic:341070”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=437463.msg3215498#msg3215498 date=1274642356]

Ok, ok, ok, ok enough is enough now I am just seeing R-S coming over here.

I think the first basic idea was better then what you guys are throwing out now, there is no need to separate by divisions they can use [317], [525], etc., But there should be a separation with things like copy and past, real tutorials, snippets. You know the real information, a configure form is just over kill.

Is this not a Runescape Private Server Community?

Isn’t the purpose of a Runescape p server to get away from Runescape and make something totally original.

If we want things to grow other then Deltascape, and crappy 508s, wouldn’t it be best to welcome more revisions over here?

Thats just my thoughts on this.
[/quote]

We can have different revisions in the same form, there really is no need to add a 317, 508,525, 556, 602, etc. That’s just over kill, we can just use [317], [508], [525], etc. We just need to separate how easy the tutorials are.[/quote]It’s multi-dimensional organizing, something SMF simply cannot do. Unless someone from the community feels like writing a CMS mod compatible with our SMF version, it’s literally impossible to create a section that organizes with both client version and difficulty.

Read full topic
item.source: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials

item.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials

[quote=“the elve age, post:14, topic:341070”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=437463.msg3215483#msg3215483 date=1274641338]
Ok, ok, ok, ok enough is enough now I am just seeing R-S coming over here.

I think the first basic idea was better then what you guys are throwing out now, there is no need to separate by divisions they can use [317], [525], etc., But there should be a separation with things like copy and past, real tutorials, snippets. You know the real information, a configure form is just over kill.
[/quote]

Is this not a Runescape Private Server Community?

Isn’t the purpose of a Runescape p server to get away from Runescape and make something totally original.

If we want things to grow other then Deltascape, and crappy 508s, wouldn’t it be best to welcome more revisions over here?

Thats just my thoughts on this.[/quote]

We can have different revisions in the same form, there really is no need to add a 317, 508,525, 556, 602, etc. That’s just over kill, we can just use [317], [508], [525], etc. We just need to separate how easy the tutorials are.

Read full topic
item.source: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials

item.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:9, topic:341070”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=437463.msg3215205#msg3215205 date=1274624345]

Compiling is an advance thing, you do need a bit of knowledge to write a decent compiler.

It’s not advanced. And javac IS the compiler. No one here is writing their own compiler, you just use a batch file to use javac.

Sarcasm? Sheesh

@topic - I do like the idea of it being sorted out, but the problem is, depending how much knowledge someone has with java, they could think some of the things that are simple to others, is really advanced and hard. This would just draw more work for mods, and alot of confusion.
[/quote]
pro idea:-
Advanced Tutorial’s section will be limited to certain pro programmers EXCEPT “Delta_” or our community will never advance.
Normal section to everyone else.
LULWUT[/quote]
Do you even know what a boolean is?

Read full topic
item.source: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials

item.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @RunesGAYpe RunesGAYpe
item.description:
@RunesGAYpe wrote:

jmood128:

But then we will have problems with people not knowing what is more advance, people will post a easy as tutorial in the advance and so on. I also suggest on to this, that all tutorial must pass a mod or some one in charge before they can be seen.

Good Idea and the ^above^ could work. If the difficulty is lets say…over 7? Then consider it advanced, you know?
This should be seriously considered.

Read full topic
item.source: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials

item.title: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Compiling is an advance thing, you do need a bit of knowledge to write a decent compiler.

1+ a decent idea out of you.

Can you have a child on a child form? If they could add another child form to the tutorial then it would probably work out good. But then we will have problems with people not knowing what is more advance, people will post a easy as tutorial in the advance and so on. But it is a decent idea to have in place.

I also suggest on to this, that all tutorial must pass a mod or some one in charge before they can be seen, some of the tutorials in the section make me feel sick.

Read full topic
item.source: Idea: Separating the Tutorial board to: Beginner Tutorials/Advanced Tutorials
